page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The Boyden Gate area is largely agricultural, most of the land being arable with a respectable fraction used for grazing. Part of the village of Hillbrough falls within the survey area, with{FISH FARMING}and{INDUSTRY} a factory making ticket vending machines. Also the Hamlets of Boyden Gate, Highstead, and Maypole, with its small{AIRFIELD.}Cottages and farm houses are scattered on a network of minor roads and lanes. Factors in human occupation and land use are geographical. East of the block the land is reclaimed marsh, the "Wantsum Channel" about 40% of total. To the west the ground rises and here people live.In summary, a traditional Kentish landscape and farming community with some innovations.
